speaker: Nyna
text: You've done it, Marth. We're here. That's Altea beneath our feet- your home.

speaker: Marth
text: Countless days have passed since Dolhr took my kingdom from me- days I would never have lived had it not been for my sister Elice's sacrifice, and the sacrifices of so many others...

speaker: Nyna
text: What became of your sister? And the rest of your family, what of them as well?

speaker: Marth
text: My father, as you know, died in Gra. I last saw my mother and sister the day the castle fell. I do not know if they still live...but I hope that they do. And if the enemy has them, I will rescue them. You can be sure of that.

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, our preparations are complete. We are ready to march.

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you.

speaker: Marth
text: Alteans and friends of the League! Join me now! Help me set Altea free, and ensure today is the last battle my people must endure!

speaker: Old Man
text: Listen well, because this is very important. There are two villages in the northwest of Altea. The easterly village is home to a paladin named Arran while the westerly village is home to a hero named Samson. They're both fine men and warriors, but their villages have been feudin' for years. You should probably resign yourself to the fact that you'll only get one of them to join your ranks. Give it some thought: the hero to the west, or the paladin to the east?

speaker: Young Girl
text: A VIP card will gain you entrance to secret shops. Where are the shops? Well, that’s the secret!

speaker: Young Man
text: A lad named Xane has been locked up in the eastern jail. They say he’s got some sort of amazing power. Wonder what it is.

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: Three orbs are enshrined at the Fane of Raman, each brimming with power. What sort of power, none can say. Well, except those who have wielded it, right?

speaker: Old Woman
text: The Altean army! Welcome home. It’s good to see you. These years been nowt but dark days; it’s about time we had something bright to look forward to.

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: Take care when usin' a devil sword. It’s a powerful blade, to be sure- but it might just claim your life instead of your foe’s.

speaker: Young Man
text: Princess Elice was prepared to die that day the castle fell. But she didn't, they say. Instead of killin' her, the Dark Pontifex Gharnef spirited her off somewhere! Oh, our poor princess... I hope she's safe.

speaker: Samson
text: My name is Samson. Once, I was a swordfighter of some renown...but that was then, and this is now. I'm happy enough with my life here in the village, but if you need another man, I will fight. Unfortunately, there has always been bad blood between our village and the next one over. They'll have closed the gates to you the moment they saw you come here. Guess that means the paladin Arran won't be fightin' with you. Them's the breaks.

speaker: Arran
text: Sire, my name is Arran. Once I was a captain to many knights... but, things change, and I came to live here in this village. If you need warriors for the coming struggle, I would be honored to fight. Unfortunately, there has always been bad blood between this village and our neighbors. No doubt they closed their gates to you as soon as they saw you come here. You won't be able to recruit the hero Samson now, I'm afraid.

speaker: Xane
text: Hey there, princey. Thanks for settin' me free! The name's Xane. I hail from a land few have heard of an even fewer have seen. I won't trouble you with the details. Me and my folk have the power to transform into other people. We can shape-shift, you see. When Doluna caught on, they started threatenin' me. Told me to join their army or "face my doom." Hah! Well, I wasn't about to waste my considerable talent on those evil coots! You, on the other hand...You've got character. Say, why don't we team up? I do owe you for savin' my hide. And I think you'll find my talents are...quite considerable.

speaker: Hollstadt
text: Well done, rabble. Anyone else would be dead by now. A shame you must end your campaign right here, before your own gates!

speaker: Hollstadt
text: Rrgh! General Camus... The rest... is in your... hands...

speaker: Malledus
text: Well done, sire! The enemy has ceased their resistance. Victory is ours!

speaker: Nyna
text: Bravo, Marth. On behalf of House Archanea, I wish to extend my heartfelt congratulations.

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you, Nyna. But it's still too soon to celebrate. We haven't freed the castle yet.

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, your soldiers have assembled for the castle raid. Perhaps you could say a few words first...

speaker: Marth
text: Altean warriors... Brave comrades. The road has been long, but at last we have driven Dolhr from my homeland. There are not words to express my gratitude to you all. You gave Altea back to me. Thank you... Thank you. ...An army of foes still haunt my castle. I mean to kick them out. Ready, my friends? Let's send these varlets scurrying!

speaker: Ogma
text: Prince Marth, I am Ogma, a mercenary of Talys. The king has bid me and my three men join your army. Cavalry has arrived from the west, flying Grust’s standard. They mean to take your life, sire. Be careful.

speaker: Young Man
text: A pirate callin’ himself Darros wants to talk to your prince. Says he’s washed his hands of pillagin’ and plunderin’ and wants to fight for the good of all. Hah! Right… And I’m a farmer who’s been sworn off rain…

speaker: Young Man
text: Curates gain experience whenever they use their staves.

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: Hammers smash right through heavy armor. You should pick one up, when you get the chance.

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh! Mighty prince of Altea! Please, will you save Sister Lena? She’s gone up into the Ghoul’s Teeth to tend to the sick there. We warned her, I swear we did… Lena is our angel. If something befell her, I- No, I won’t think of it. Take this gold: we’ve 5000 pieces. Just promise you’ll use it to bring her home to us unharmed.

speaker: Darros
text: Ahoy, Prince Marth, I be Darros, a simple man o’ the sea. I’ve had me fill o’ the piratin’ life, and now I be lookin’ t’start anew. What say ye? Make me yer matey, and I swear t’pull me load.

speaker: Caeda
text: Castor?! It is you, isn’t it? Must even good men like you betray Talys now?

speaker: Castor
text: Princess Caeda? Oh…I’m sorry, but me mother’s sick, and the medicine don’t buy itself, see…

speaker: Caeda
text: So you agreed to fight for the pirates in exchange for coin…All right then. If it’s gold you need, take mine. Here, this is all I have. Take it, and go to your mother’s side.

speaker: Castor
text: But Princess…I betrayed you! …Ach, I’ve been a fool! Forgive me, Princess. Let me fight for you now. Me life is yours.

speaker: Caeda
text: Ogma!

speaker: Ogma
text: Princess...

speaker: Caeda
text: I never got to thank you for coming along with us. There's no swordsman I trust more. I've seen your strength.

speaker: Ogma
text: You don't need to thank me, Princess. I'm just doing my job. Speaking of which, your father would flay me if you came to any harm. Do me a favor, and leave the dangerous fighting to me and my men.

speaker: Caeda
text: I don't need protecting, Ogma. ...I've got another job for you. Protect Marth for me.

speaker: Ogma
text: But, Princess...

speaker: Caeda
text: He's very important to me. And the world... But mostly to me. So do as I ask, Ogma. Keep him safe. That's my first and last request.

speaker: Ogma
text: Very well. How could I say no to you?

speaker: Caeda
text: Thank you, Ogma. I knew you'd understand. All right, I have to go. But I hope we get to talk like this more. You're a good listener.

speaker: Ogma
text: ...Princess

speaker: Caeda
text: Yes?

speaker: Ogma
text: You keep yourself safe, too. Marth would grieve if anything befell you.

speaker: Caeda
text: Fair enough. Thank you, Ogma. You're very kind.

speaker: Castor
text: Prince Marth, I am Castor of Talys. I wish to add my bow to your strength.

speaker: Marth
text: Of course. Caeda told me about you.

speaker: Castor
text: You know, she’s always been very kind to me, sire, even before I left Talys. And look how I’ve repaid her…

speaker: Marth
text: Castor, you can still show her your heart is true. Let the battles to come be what defines you!

speaker: Gomer
text: The gall of ye, defyin' me crew! I'll put an axe square between yer eyes! Ye ain't leaving here alive. I swear it on the rickety peg leg o'Shanty Pete!

speaker: Gomer
text: Augh... Fiends, ye be...

speaker: Villager
text: You have our gratitude, sire, for finally chasin’ those pirates away. Now, as I hear it, you plan to march on to Aurelis…That’ll take you right up through the Ghoul’s Teeth. With all due respect, sire, you’re taking a great risk crossin’ those mountains that’s Soothsire territory. The Soothsires are fearsome bandits, always raidin’ the villages and harryin’ what travelers dare pass by. And the swordsman with ’em- goes by the name o’ Navarre- he’s a terror with a blade, so they say. If you go up there, keep your wits about you- or you won’t come back down.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire! You've a visitor from the castle. It's Princess Caeda!

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda, what is it? You look white as a sheet!

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth, come quickly! It’s the castle... Galdr's pirates attacked from out of nowhere... They stormed the gates and cut down everyone in their path! I fear for my father's life...

speaker: Marth
text: Steady, Caeda. You did well to come find us. Altea's bravest knights aren't about to hand Talys to that flock of seafowl. Come, we'll make for the castle now!

speaker: Old Man
text: Villages will keep their gates open for Prince Marth, but he must be quick – if a thief reaches a village before the prince does, there may not be any more village left to visit.

speaker: Young Man
text: I hear you need a high weapon level to wield the strongest weapons. Another thing: Keep your fliers away from those enemy archers!

speaker: Young Man
text: A knight belongs on the front lines, if you ask me. That thick armor can take a lot of abuse, so they should be up front protecting the other units.

speaker: Teenage Boy
text: Galder? That's the harbor town west of Talys out beyond the water. These days, a pirate by the name of Gomer calls the shots there. The whole town's at the mercy of his crew.

speaker: Old Woman
text: A man of the staff by the name of Wrys lives in the village south of the castle. He was hopin' to meet your prince.

speaker: Old Man
text: Prince Marth! 'Tis good you stopped by. The villagers have collected 10,000 gold pieces. If it please you, use the money to arm your warriors, and rid our land of those pirates.

speaker: Wrys
text: I am Wrys, a humble curate. I cannot fight, but this staff I carry can heal your wounded. Take me with you, and you'll be very glad you did.

speaker: Gazzak
text: The might of Altea, ye say, now? Har! Ye sprogs look t’be a mite short o’mighty t’me.

speaker: Gazzak
text: Rrgh... Ye'll pay, dog...

speaker: Talys King
text: Ah, Prince Marth! You have saved us in our hour of need. Please accept my thanks. Lad, I believe you are ready. If you wish to seek out allies in Aurelis, I will give you what soldiers I can to see you arrive there safely. Captain Ogma is a fine swordsman, brave and true. I know he and his fighters will serve you well. Another thing...During your travels, you are certain to meet many who despise Dolhr. Some may be hiding in villages; other may have been captured or forced to fight against their will or better judgment. It falls upon you to find these individuals and win them over your cause. Understood, lad? Then go! The time has come! Be patient, steady, strong: I know you will do great things.

speaker: Larissa
text: Have the villagers given up struggling yet?

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: With that ogre on the loose? Hardly, sir. All of our soldiers together still can’t contain him. The other villagers have fled into the caverns, out of reach.

speaker: Larissa
text: What? Grr, enough of this! The League will be here soon. Take your positions! We’ll deal with them first and cut that giant down to size later.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Ymir, you’re hurt!

speaker: Ymir
text: Am I? I hardly feel it.

speaker: Old Man
text: Why would you try to take on an entire army just for our sake?

speaker: Ymir
text: Because you treat me like a human being. Do I need another reason?

speaker: Old Woman
text: Ymir... thank you.

speaker: Ymir
text: I’ll be standing guard outside the cavern. Nobody will hurt you, I swear it.

speaker: Marth
text: Who are you? You don’t seem to be one of Grust’s soldiers.

speaker: Ymir
text: You just keep your distance. I’m not letting anyone near the villagers in here, and that includes you!

speaker: Marth
text: You wrong me, sir. I’m here to rout the last of Grust’s army. To save you.

speaker: Ymir
text: Yeah? Well, they said the same thing when they led us down here. And look where that got us. I’m not fallin’ for the same lies twice!

speaker: Marth
text: I speak the truth. But, if my word is not good enough, so be it. Stand aside and watch us fight. Let the battle prove I mean what I say. Agreed? Either way, you are in danger here. Take the villagers and hide until this is over.

speaker: Ymir
text: ...So I’m supposed to just sit here, when I could be fightin’?

speaker: Marth
text: Just give me a chance to prove I’m here to protect you.

speaker: Ymir
text: ...Fine. I’ll stay out of it. For now. But if I find you’re lyin’ to me, I’ll split you right down the middle!

speaker: Ymir
text: The villagers are countin’ on me. I won’t let you through!

speaker: Ymir
text: Rrgh... I’m sorry... I tried...

speaker: Larissa
text: We’ll never surrender to you Akaneian rabble! Long live Grust!

speaker: Larissa
text: Rebel... scum...

speaker: Old Man
text: Prince Marth, thank you. Those soldiers told us they’d protect us when they led us down here... but they were just using us as leverage, hostages to keep you at bay! If you hadn’t shown up, they might have just killed us outright in the end...

speaker: Ymir
text: Prince Marth, sorry I doubted you.

speaker: Marth
text: Well, at least we’ve cleared up the misunderstanding.

speaker: Ymir
text: Since you came to the villagers’ rescue, how ’bout I help you out as a way of sayin’ thanks?

speaker: Marth
text: You mean... join our army?

speaker: Ymir
text: I’m strongest in the land! Well, second strongest, at least. I can hold my own in battle. But if you don’t want a monster in your ranks, I understand...

speaker: Marth
text: Monster? You’re a giant among men, to be sure, but a hero as well! Any warrior who can fend of an entire army is welcome among us!

speaker: Ymir
text: Then count me in! Let’s see how many more armies break themselves against me, eh!

speaker: Malledus
text: Aurelis, at last…The enemy will have sent their forces to meet us.

speaker: Marth
text: Grust, Dolhr, Gra..We’re up against their standing armies, and we must brace ourselves for it.

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, I believe it prudent that we start taking time to prepare our troops before each battle. We should select the warriors best suited for the situation and outfit them with the right weapons and items accordingly.

speaker: Marth
text: All right, that’s sound advice- I believe I’ll take it.

speaker: Bentheon
text: An unknown army to the south? That must be the Altean princeling and his band of lickspittles. If they think we’ll sit by and let them join forces with the Aurelians, then they have another think coming. With this ridersbane, I’ll litter the lea with their cavalry!

speaker: Young Man
text: Weapons can be crafted of iron, steel, or silver, each metal more powerful than the last. You’’l need to raise your weapon level accordingly, though, before you can use them.

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: When facing armored knights or generals, you’ll want to arm yourself with a sword they call an armorslayer. Then there’s the ridersbane, which makes short work of cavaliers and paladins- but only knights and cavalry can wield it. The rapier is effective against armored units AND cavalry. But you need to be a prince to wield that one! Also, keep in mind that weapons wear down with use and eventually break.

speaker: Young Man
text: General Bentheon who guards the castle was carrying a ridersbane last I saw. Keep your cavaliers away, or that weapon could spell the end of ‘em.

speaker: Old Man
text: Did you know you can use keys to unlock doors and lower bridges? …You did? Ahem! Right, of course you did.

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: There’s no terror like the dracoknight. One false move when they’re flyin’ about, and you can kiss your life goodbye.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Kind Altean, this kingdom is in dire need of a savior. We’ve saved up 5,000 gold and poured our prayers into every coin. Please, use this money to answer them.

speaker: Merric
text: Aha! Prince Marth. We meet again.

speaker: Marth
text: …Huh? Merric?! Merric, is that you?

speaker: Merric
text: Well, yes, sire, last I looked. Whilst studying magic in Khadein, I caught wind of a war brewing and decided to seek you out.

speaker: Marth
text: I see… Thank you, then. I need friends like you on the battlefield. You will fight with us, of course?

speaker: Merric
text: Of course! ‘Twould be a passing shame if you didn’t get to see me flex a little magic muscle. Wait till I show you my latest: Excalibur!

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena… Where are you? What I would give to hear your voice just once before I die…

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena… Forgive your…fool of a brother…

speaker: Lena
text: Matthis? Is that you?

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena?! What are you doing on a battlefield?

speaker: Lena
text: I was attacked by bandits in the Teeth while tending to the sick there, and these people saved me. The real question is, what are YOU doing on a battlefield- least of all this one!

speaker: Matthis
text: I’m not here by choice, sister of mine. Since you left, Macedon has only gotten worse and worse. They forced me to enlist- you know I hate warfare, but it was into the army or onto the chopping block.

speaker: Lena
text: Shame on you, Matthis. If you’re going to fight, then at least fight for something you believe in. Medon has done terrible things: marrying their might to Doluna, helping them torment people…Brother, it’s not too late. You could join Altea’s forces. They’re good people you know. Prince Marth would welcome you. They all would.

speaker: Matthis
text: …All right, then. If I’m gonna to die, I’d rather die as one of the dashing than one of the dastardly. You know, Lena, you always were the reliable one and now you’re all grown up…I thought for sure you’d have already settled down with your one true love.

speaker: Lena
text: T-true love? I’ve…I’ve met no such man, Matthis.

speaker: Matthis
text: Hmm, is that so? I’ll bet you haven’t… Well, you just be careful. There are plenty of thieves out there who would steal a girl’s heart.

speaker: Marth
text: You must be Matthis, Sister Lena’s-

speaker: Matthis
text: ACK! Y-you’re Prince Marth! Aieee! S-s-stay your rapier, I beg you!

speaker: Marth
text: …What has gotten into you?

speaker: Matthis
text: You mean…you haven’t come to stick me like a pig for fighting under the Macedonian standard?

speaker: Marth
text: Er, no…

speaker: Matthis
text: Really?

speaker: Marth
text: Really and truly.

speaker: Matthis
text: Oh! Uh, right then… Sorry about that little display. I guess Lena was right. Just goes to show not all princes are cut from the same cloth!

speaker: Marth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Matthis
text: Oh, well, our prince- Prince Michalis of Macedon, that is- he’s strong, and proud…and an utter tyrant. They say he put the soldiers who look the most scared in the front lines on purpose.

speaker: Marth
text: Hmm… Prince Michalis of Medon…

speaker: Matthis
text: Don’t worry, sire, I won’t mistake you for him again! Altean princes I can trust!

speaker: Bentheon
text: You can defy us, yes... But you will never defeat us.

speaker: Bentheon
text: W...what...

speaker: Elder
text: Prince Marth, you have our thanks for liberating the south castle. You’ll find Captain Hardin protecting the king and the lady Nyna at the Northern Fortress, located in Aurelis. When you find him, please be sure to give him this silver sword.

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth, you did it. It's finally over.

speaker: Marth
text: I've waiting a long time for this day. And now I'm not entirely certain what to do with it...

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth... um, we haven't talked much since leaving Talys. But I thought.. Do you know where you will be going?

speaker: Marth
text: To Altea, of course. War has left my kingdom in ruins. I cannot waste another day; I must return to help rebuild.

speaker: Caeda
text: So... I suppose that means you have bid Talys farewell for good...

speaker: Marth
text: Don't be silly, Caeda. I need to at least go thank your father and tell him the fighting is done.

speaker: Caeda
text: My father...? Marth, I'm not asking about my- Never mind. Please excuse me...

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, did something happen? I just passed Caeda, and she looked heartbroken...

speaker: Marth
text: No... Well, we were just talking. And she asked me...

speaker: Nyna
text: Ha ha, oh, Marth... How can a man who faced the Shadow Dragon be so desperate to avoid facing his own feelings?

speaker: Marth
text: I- my- what? I don't know what you are talking about.

speaker: Nyna
text: You wish to send Caeda home to Talys, then, and return to Altea alone? That is what you want?

speaker: Marth
text: Well, that's where we both belong. I don't see what my wants have to do with anything.

speaker: Nyna
text: Clearly not. Marth, if you have anything to say to Caeda, say it now. Love cannot always make the leap from heart to heart by itself; sometimes you must speak it aloud and give it wings. Surely a great leader like you can muster the courage for that?

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda... might I, er, have a moment?

speaker: Marth
text: I did not speak with my heart before. When I said I would go to Altea, I... Well, I had meant... I hoped you would be at my side.

speaker: Marth
text: As you said, we have not spoken much since Talys. With you, I felt I never had to say a word. If the battle started to take its toll, you were always there... close by... I would see you there, so beaut- ahem, so brave... and I would, um,.... derive! Yes, derive great strength! Derive... ....Ugh, why is this so difficult?! Caeda, I'm just trying to tell you I-

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth... Shh. Me too... Me too.

speaker: Nyna
text: Well done, Marth. Our struggle is finally over. You have saved our world.

speaker: Marth
text: Not just me. Many fought at my side... And died.

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth... You loved her, didn't you? Caeda.

speaker: Marth
text: ...She was the one I most wanted to keep safe. But I failed, and I have lost her forever... It occurs to me now that perhaps she was the one protecting me all along. Caeda... Why did you take up arms with a fool like me?

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, do not blame yourself. ...Remember Anri and Artemis. We are their descendants; perhaps we were always meant to share their curse as well as their blood. And... perhaps only the curse has exacted its price could our battle with the Shadow Dragon be won. This peace we have made... We must cherish it, Marth. We have both paid so dearly for it. Let us work together to ensure none must endure a tragedy like our again.

speaker: Marth
text: We made it. Now we just have to find Medeus...

speaker: Nagi
text: I can sense it... A sinister will is at work here...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, you have fought splendidly.

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Gotoh?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Gotoh
text: I washed my hands of humankind and their foolish ways long ago. But you and your companions have convinced me that was a rash decision. Perhaps there is hope for you yet. Allow me to offer what help I can.

speaker: Marth
text: You mean you’ll fight with us?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Yes. I may lack the power to stop Medeus, but his minions are another story. Let this old man strike them down and clear a path for you. ...The gods have chosen you, Marth, prince of light.

speaker: Marth
text: Come, my friends! We have a dragon to tame! Help me confine Medeus to the shadows for all eternity and bring light back into the world!

speaker: Cain
text: His last words were as follows: “Tell my son that I leave the future of Altea and our continent in his hands.”

speaker: Malledus
text: Your sister knows that you are the future of Altea- nay, the whole land!

speaker: Medeus
text: Foolish humans! You dare disturb me while I slumber? Oh, how you will regret it as you die slowly...painfully...writhing in the fires of the inferno!

speaker: Medeus
text: Nngh... Defeated again... by humans! Know this, Altean prince... That light which surrounds you is only a temporary respite. So long as the darkness in your hearts continues to sustain me... I cannot be... destroyed...... Rrraaahhh!!!

speaker: Medeus
text: Hmm? So... I am not the only dragon revived. I had heard you perished the last time. No matter; you've recovered even less of your power than me. This time, you have no chance!

speaker: Minerva
text: General Harmein, I cannot abide by these tactics of yours. Let me attack the rebels head-on, and keep my pride as a knight of Macedon.

speaker: Harmein
text: Ah, you mean the same pride that cost us all those soldiers back in Aurelis? I think not, Princess. If we’re to regroup, we need to buy time. My tactics are necessary. The emperor himself has named me commander of this post. Either obey, or accept the consequences. Your little sister Maria is still under our word, is she not? What a shame it would be, if we decided we could no longer care for her…

speaker: Minerva
text: Enough! …I will obey. But the Altean knights are smarter than you give them credit for. They will prevail here, and you will regret having acting so rashly, General.

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: Say, did you happen to get a look at the axe wrapped in Minerva’s princessly fingers? No, I suppose not, otherwise you’d not be standing here. That axe is Hauteclere, the strongest axe of ‘em all. Nobody knows who made it or where, but it’s said to rival even the three regalia, Archanea’s mightiest weapons. Why, if she got her hands on Iote’s Shield (that’un being Macedon’s treasure, see) she’d be nigh unstoppable!

speaker: Bantu
text: You there. Have you come across a young girl, one by the name of Tiki? She must be found, boy! Tiki is the last of the Naga, the divine-dragon clan. Without her powers, we cannot challenge the Manaketes who serve Medeus… Me? I haven’t the power. I am a fire dragon, yes… But in the name alone, in name alone. I lost my firestone in Pyrathi. Without it, I cannot do battle. …You will be traveling much, yes? I wish to go with you. Perhaps together we can find Tiki.

speaker: Minerva
text: Fie, enough! I’ve no stomach for these cat-and-mouse tactics. Come, Whitewings, we fly! Hyah!

speaker: Minerva
text: Rrgh… I can’t keep up the fight with these wounds… I must withdraw.

speaker: Palla
text: I serve Princess Minerva, not Grust. This battle is over.

speaker: Catria
text: The commander left? Then I’ve no reason to stay.

speaker: Est
text: Sorry, General. My place is with the commander.

speaker: Harmein
text: Curse Minerva and her pride! Grr, no matter. If I am to die here, then I won't be dying alone!

speaker: Harmein
text: Aaargh...Traitors...every...where...

speaker: Malledus
text: Prince Marth, I was wondering if we might talk about the Manaketes.

speaker: Marth
text: Manaketes? You mean the dragonkin?

speaker: Malledus
text: Yes, sire. I was not sure how much knowledge you had of the Manaketes. The Manaketes inhabited our continent long before the dawn of humanity. However, ordinarily their draconic disposition stayed suppressed; their power sealed within special stones. Thus rather than terrorizing humankind, they chose to live simple, peaceful lives in the quieter reaches of the world. However, a century ago, something changed. Medeus, the Shadow Dragon, surfaced in the Dolhr region and created what would be a great empire there. His forces invaded the human realm, and in the blink of an eye, he had subjected all of the land. It was then, in that darkest hour, that a young man named Anri appeared, and rose against the Shadow Dragon. In his head was a shining blade of light- Falchion- which he plunged into Medeus- and the tyrant was no more. Anri went on to found Altea- and the rest, I believe, you know.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, Malledus… Is that what this was about? I do know my own kingdom’s history. And I know what I must do, now that Medeus has revived and restored Dolhr to its former might.

speaker: Malledus
text: You are Anri’s last male descendant, the only one who can wield Falchion. You must find the blade that was taken, and put an end to Doluna and its misguided Manakete rulers.

speaker: Marth
text: I will finish what my father started. I will avenge him, and bring light back into our world.

speaker: Caesar
text: Prince Marth, I am Caesar, and this is Radd. We are hired swords in the service of Port Warren. Grust has gathered its knights by the fortresses to the north. It's dangerous for you to stay here. Thankfully, the eastern castle has been left almost entirely unguarded; that's the place to strike. Please be careful, sire. We'll be fighting with you all the way.

speaker: Old Woman
text: They say a princess of Macedon is being held captive inside Castle Deil. That's odd, don’t you think? Why would Dolhr imprison their own ally?

speaker: Young Man
text: I saw loads of enemy soldiers up by the northern fortresses! They’ll be pouring out of the gates any minute now. You’d better send someone to bar the exits before they do!

speaker: Roger
text: I bear you no ill will, but what can I say? A war's a war.

speaker: Caeda
text: Good day, sir.

speaker: Roger
text: Ack!

speaker: Caeda
text: Peace, I’ve no wish to fight you. My name is Caeda. I hail from Talys.

speaker: Roger
text: Wh-what are you talking to me for?! This is a battlefield!

speaker: Caeda
text: Might I trouble you by asking your name, good sir?

speaker: Roger
text: M-my name? That’s- It’s Roger... Why?

speaker: Caeda
text: Hee hee, forgive me, Roger, it’s just you looked sweet and kind. I just had to stop and talk to you. Tell me: do you believe in love? Oh, listen to me. I’m sure you already have a sweetheart back in Grust.

speaker: Roger
text: What?! No, no! I... mean, er, I’m quite unattached at the moment.

speaker: Caeda
text: Roger, think of the children- the poor women and children who shed tears every day this war drags on. I joined the Archanean League to put an end to it, but I just...just...*Sniff* Oh, Roger, doesn't it break your heart?

speaker: Roger
text: Aye, miss. There, there. I, too, wish nothing more than for this needless war to end.

speaker: Caeda
text: Then...would you consider fighting with us to end it?

speaker: Roger
text: What? Oh heavens, no... I’m sorry, but I could never betray my kingdom.

speaker: Caeda
text: Ah, yes, I see. You must have family back in Grust who are counting on you.

speaker: Roger
text: No, not especially. My parents are dead, and it’s not as if I’ve a girl to call my own. But Grust is my home- always has been. I won’t betray her.

speaker: Caeda
text: And I cannot convince you to change your mind?

speaker: Roger
text: I’m afraid not, miss.

speaker: Caeda
text: All right, sorry to bother you. But I’m glad we had this chance to talk, Roger. You’re every bit the man I thought you were. Goodbye, then...

speaker: Roger
text: Wait- you’re leaving?!

speaker: Caeda
text: Well, yes, Roger, I must! Every moment I stay here, I put you at risk. What if your comrades thought you were conspiring with the enemy? No, I must go...

speaker: Roger
text: ...You’re very kind, Caeda. Dare I say, we don’t have girls quite like you back in Grust. Um, perhaps...I suppose I could...Aw, heck, I’m going with you!

speaker: Roger
text: Prince Marth? I’m Roger, a Grustian soldier. Well, at least I was. I’m through fighting against you. Let me join your League.

speaker: Marth
text: Well, certainly. We need all the strong allies we can get. But why the sudden change of heart?

speaker: Roger
text: Well, er... There’s this fetching girl named Caeda who asked me to, and, uh... What can I say? I think I’m in love. Try saying no to a girl who comes racing up to you in the heat of battle just to ask if you believe in love! Whew! I must’ve turned red as a strawberry! Heh heh...

speaker: Kannival
text: W-what are you doing all the way out here? Blast, I'm finished...!

speaker: Kannival
text: Long...live...Grust! Nngff...

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, it's too dangerous to stay here. We must flee to Pyrathi. There are risks there, too- the Pyrathi king Mannu is said to be a descendant of the dragonkin, a Manakete. Still, we've no other recourse. We'll just have to take our chances... Keep your wits about you, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: Nyna, soon the palace will be in sight. I...know this can't be easy for you.

speaker: Nyna
text: ...When the palace fell, many, many good Archaneans were killed. The royal family...My family were...Their bodies were hung before the gates as an example. I cannot unpaint that vivid picture, of my parents grotesquely changed...I feel as though I should cry, Marth; or scream. But no tears come, and I cannot chase away the sadness and rage... ...I cannot change the past. I can only shape the future. Lead the way, Marth. I am ready. Take me home.

speaker: Young Man
text: This here is Knorda, Archanea’s closest market town. Drop by the armories and vendors if you’ve an interest in rare goods.

speaker: Young Man
text: A gang of ruffians have rounded up some Archanean folk and are holdin! em over at the edge of town. What a world it’s become, that we’ve gotta be prisoners in our own land!

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: Three ancient weapons known as the Regalia have been passed down through the generations of House Archanea: Parthia, the bow of flame; Gradivus, the lance that pierces stone; and Mercurius, the spectral sword. Only those blessed by the gods may lay hands on them- or so it goes.

speaker: Old Woman
text: I’m sick of war. If it ain’t the screams of battle you’re hearin! it’s the bawlin! of the widows! You all should go home to your loved ones if you ask me.

speaker: Young Man
text: Watch out for the ballisticians. They can fire their missiles quite a long ways. If you see they’re usin! a weapon called an arrowspate, move your fliers out of there, before their wings get clipped! Also, ballisticians have a weapon called the thunderbolt, which is particularly effective against other ballisticians.

speaker: Anna
text: Not everybody fighting for Grust is a bad apple, you know. Take my sweetheart, Jake. He’s got a heart of gold, that one. If you see him, tell him Anna’s worried sick about him. ’Course, my Jake won’t talk to no-one but the most beautiful of women! That’s just the way he is.

speaker: Anna
text: I hope this warring is over and done with soon. And I hope my Jake is well.

speaker: Anna
text: Jake! What are you doing back?...Oh, so you've decided to fight for the Archanean League now?...No, no, I won't stop you. Sure, I wish you'd just stay put for a change, but I know you wouldn't fight unless it were for a fine cause indeed. Go get 'em, honeycomb!

speaker: Anna
text: Go get 'em, Jake!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Heh. Whadda you want? A broken nose?

speaker: Marth
text: I hear you are holding some Archaneans here against their will. Release them at once!

speaker: Ruffian
text: How ’bout I release my fist into yer- Munchin! Manaketes! The Altean army?! Aieee! Get me outta here!!!

speaker: Marth
text: Is everyone all right? I know you’ve been through a lot. Go home to your families.

speaker: Marth
text: Em? What’s wrong, lad? Why don't you go home?

speaker: Boy
text: Because! I have no home to go to.

speaker: Marth
text: You! You’re a girl! Why were you dressed as a boy?

speaker: Linde
text: To hide, sir. My name is Linde. My father is – was – Miloah, a pontifex. I donned men’s garb to escape Gharnef, but no sooner was I away when those ruffians grabbed me.

speaker: Marth
text: So you’re Linde! I’m glad you’re safe. Princess Nyna was worried about you, you know! Well, we’re all together now. I promise to keep you out of danger.

speaker: Linde
text: No! Let me fight. With Princess Nyna’s blessing, and the tome my father left me, I can wield Aura magic. Let me use it to avenge him. I want to destroy Gharnef myself!

speaker: Caeda
text: Hail, ballistician of Grust! Are you the one they call Jake?

speaker: Jake
text: Hail yourself, sugar! What's a fetching lass like you doing out here on the battlefield? And how do you know my name?

speaker: Caeda
text: I am Caeda of Talys. An Archanean woman by the name of Anna told me about you.

speaker: Jake
text: Really? Anna mentioned me? ...In a good way, right?

speaker: Caeda
text: She's very worried about you. She wants to know why such a good man is fighting for the wrong side.

speaker: Jake
text: Wrong side? Hmm... Well, I have to admit, I'm not too keen on kicking Archanea while they're down...

speaker: Caeda
text: They why not fight for Archanea instead? Help us defeat Grust and Dolhr, and set the world right.

speaker: Jake
text: Well...I don't know. I don't think it's that simple... Hmm...

speaker: Caeda
text: Anna would love you for it, I'm sure.

speaker: Jake
text: She would? Hmmm... All right, you win. But I'm doin' it for Anna- " just to be clear!

speaker: Jake
text: I knew I wasn't cut out for the military. Well, too late now. I just hope Anna's OK...

speaker: Merric
text: Linde, I presume? My name's Merric. Prince Marth asked me to look after you. Not that we mages need any help looking after ourselves, mind you. "

speaker: Linde
text: Oh, you've studied magic?

speaker: Merric
text: Yes, in Khadein.

speaker: Linde
text: Khadein... The school? My father was a student there a long time ago.

speaker: Merric
text: The school is beautiful–was beautiful, until Gharnef took over and changed everything. I was blessed with wonderful teachers, and I found a healthy mix of friends and rivals in the other aspiring mages.

speaker: Linde
text: It sounds nice, I suppose. But my father was the only teacher and friend I ever needed. ......

speaker: Merric
text: I'm sorry, Linde...

speaker: Linde
text: Don't be. I'm tough like my father, too. ...Let's talk about you, Merric. And about Khadein. I've never been to a school before. How do they teach?

speaker: Jake
text: Are you the Altean prince? The name’s Jake. I just joined up.

speaker: Marth
text: Many thanks, Jake.

speaker: Jake
text: You know, I’ve been to Altea once. Have you uh... Ever paid a visit to the ecret-say op-shay there?

speaker: Marth
text: The what?

speaker: Jake
text: The secret shop! Didn’t you know there are secret shops hidden all over the continent? Well, there’s one in Altea, too.

speaker: Marth
text: Oh, really? Where exactly?

speaker: Jake
text: If I told you, it wouldn’t be much of a secret, now would it? The entrance is disguised so you can’t find it.

speaker: Marth
text: Disguised?!

speaker: Jake
text: And they don’t let anybody in without a VIP card. So don’t expect to waltz through the door by accident.

speaker: Marth
text: But how do they stay in business?

speaker: Jake
text: Who knows! Last I heard, they were desperate for customers.

speaker: Marth
text: Then maybe they should reopen as a "tell your friends " shop.

speaker: Jake
text: Ha! Very clever. Anyway, you should drop by when you’re in the neighborhood.

speaker: Marth
text: But I don’t know- Ugh. Never mind.

speaker: Khozen
text: Burn...! Burn, till your blood boils and your flesh cooks!

speaker: Khozen
text: Emperor Medeus...I have failed you...

speaker: Marth
text: Good news, Nyna! We've wrested control of the gates from the enemy.

speaker: Nyna
text: Then...we've won!

speaker: Marth
text: Not quite yet. We can enter the palace, but Dolhr still holds strong inside her walls. Also, a number of knights are being held captive inside.

speaker: Nyna
text: Loyal soldiers who fought for their kingdom and their people...Marth, I wish to free them as soon as possible.

speaker: Marth
text: I understand. We should strike now, then, before enemy reinforcements can arrive. I believe we have a good chance.

speaker: Nyna
text: Thank you, Marth. As always, I am counting on you. Worry no more.

speaker: Michalis
text: Lord Gotoh, the League has begun its attack. I wish for you to move someplace safe until the fighting has ended.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Why not just end this folly now, Michalis?

speaker: Michalis
text: Folly? What folly?

speaker: Gotoh
text: You loved your younger sister so much. It pains me to see you quarrel. If you and Minerva had worked as one, Macedon might have become a great kingdom- greater even than Archanea, perhaps. But instead, you let Gharnef trick you into destroying your family, and your kingdom with it.

speaker: Michalis
text: ...I cannot undo what is done. My father’s blood will always be on my hands, just as Minerva’s betrayal of her brother and country will be on hers. And Macedon has not been destroyed, not yet. So long as I carry Iote's Shield, the League’s arrows cannot fell me.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Very well. And if you win? What then?

speaker: Michalis
text: If I win, I will tell you. Right now, my only goal is to gut that Altean prince who leads the League. My pride as Macedonian king rests upon it.

speaker: Gotoh
text: I see... Then we’ve nothing more to discuss, have we?

speaker: Gotoh
text: The weight of his father’s murder threatens to crush him... Poor boy...Poor fool.

speaker: Old Woman
text: A great sage lives in the village to the north. He’s not very sociable, though. Hardly anyone ever sees him.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, Marth, why did you not heed me? Why did you not bring the two orbs? Without them, I cannot make Starlight for you. You will not be able to break through Gharnef’s Imhullu magic, not take Falchion from his clutches. Without Anri’s sword, your battle with Medeus will be fraught with peril. If you still mean to face him, you will need all the strength you can muster, every advantage you can find. If you have weapons like the sword Mercurius or the lance Gradivus, the fight may not be lost... Hmm... I, too, may be able to help in some other way. Let me think on it. Regardless, your quest has just become more difficult than you realize. I hope you are ready.

speaker: Gotoh
text: You have the Lightsphere and Starsphere with you? Well done! Now I can create Starlight for you.

speaker: Gotoh
text: ...There. It is finished. Take this with you; it is the only magic capable of breaking through Imhullu. Use it to stop that fiend Gharnef once and for all.

speaker: Michalis
text: Made it this far, have you? Don’t gloat yet. My Dragoons and I still rule these skies!

speaker: Michalis
text: Minerva, I have missed you, Sister. Let us embrace one last time.

speaker: Minerva
text: Michalis...

speaker: Michalis
text: Well? Strike! A moment’s hesitation spells death on the battlefield. I know I taught you better.

speaker: Minerva
text: You will not lay down your lance and walk the right path?

speaker: Michalis
text: Don’t be a child. There are no right paths; just mine and yours, two that will never cross.

speaker: Minerva
text: Very well. Then you leave me no choice. Embrace you I shall, Brother!

speaker: Michalis
text: M-Maria? What are you doing here?

speaker: Michalis
text: The Whitewings? Ha! Come to try and slay your king?

speaker: Michalis
text: The Whitewings? Ha! Come to try and slay your king?

speaker: Michalis
text: The Whitewings? Ha! Come to try and slay your king?

speaker: Michalis
text: I’ve been waiting for you, Altean whelp. I swear on my crown, you will die!

speaker: Michalis
text: Aaagh! I am finished. Forgive me, my people.

speaker: Marth
text: First General Camus of Grust... Now Prince Michalis of Macedon. Men of such promise... Had the times been different, the two might have led illustrious lives.

speaker: Malledus
text: Yes, Prince Michalis was a brilliant man with great things ahead of him. But in the end, the rashness of youth did him in.

speaker: Marth
text: Only because Gharnef found his weakness and exploited it. Until we stop that fiend, this spiral of misery will never cease.

speaker: Malledus
text: Then shall we go to Thabes? Lord Gotoh said the city lies someplace far to the north of Khadein.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, in the heart of the desert...

speaker: Malledus
text: Thabes is an old city... None in recent memory have gone there and returned alive. Within its walls remain many powerful apparatus crafted of long-forgotten magic. Lord Gotoh believes Gharnef is harnessing their power, and that is why he wields such influence over the continent.

speaker: Marth
text: And he has Imhullu as well... This will be a struggle.

speaker: Marth
text: Still, Gharnef’s reign must end. The world was so much more beautiful before he painted it red...

speaker: Gharnef
text: What? The dregs of Archanea have come to challenge my kingdom? Ha ha ha... Really, do they think people have not tried before? So long as I possess this Imhullu magic, they cannot snuff my life out. No one can. As for the White Sage... He will trouble me no longer. With the dragon-goddess right where I want her, in the Fane of Raman, there is no way for Gotoh's Starlight to disperse the shadows that guard me.

speaker: Young Man
text: Fight Gharnef? Are you mad? You'll never stop him! His magic, Imhullu, summons up foul spirits that protect him! Only the White Sage Gotoh's magic can undo him: the magic of Starli- Whoa, there. I need to hold my tongue! He might be listenin' with those wizard-ears of his, for all I know. Go on, work a little magic yourself and disappear, huh? Shoo!

speaker: Young Man
text: You think those clothes o'metal will protect you from mages? Ha! Armor won't save you. You need a Barrier staff! Another thing, about Gharnef- here, move in closer in case he's listenin'. You don't want to fight him head on. He never stays put in Khadein for very long anyway. If he tries to attack you, ride it out. Good things come to those who wait.

speaker: Gharnef
text: You dare oppose me, fool? You must not value your life. Cower before the might of the magic Imhullu: once forbidden, now unleashed!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Altean prince! I fear you are not quite imposing enough to warrant my staying here. But if it's Falchion you want, come and take it. I shall be waiting at the Temple of Thabes.

speaker: Marth
text: No Falchion...The battle was for naught.

speaker: Gotoh
text: ...Marth...Prince Marth.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Who are you?!

speaker: Gotoh
text: My name is Gotoh...I am speaking to you from Macedon through magic.

speaker: Marth
text: Gotoh...the White Sage?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Some have used that name, yes. You must listen to me. As you suspect, Gharnef has made off with Falchion. With Imhullu and Falchion in the sorcerer's grasp, Dolhr now must think twice before challenging him. Gharnef knows this. And one day, he plans to conquer Dolhr and rule the entire world.

speaker: Marth
text: Is Imhullu so powerful a magic, then?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Yes. The mage who wields it cannot be killed; cannot be so much as scratched. I was the magic's guardian once. Knowing its forbidden power could work terrible evils, so I kept it close. But Gharnef, one of my two pupils- Miloah being the other- took the forbidden tome and vanished. Now you are paying for my carelessness. Forgive me. I wish to make amends by teaching you the only way to undo Imhullu's power.

speaker: Marth
text: Which is...?

speaker: Gotoh
text: It is called Starlight. One blast is enough to break through Imhullu's shadowy protection. But to cast the magic, you need two orbs: the Lightsphere and the Starsphere. Heed me, Marth. When you find the Lightsphere and Starsphere, bring them to me. Then I will give you the magic you seek. Then you will have Starlight, and with it, Gharnef's reign will end.

speaker: Dejanira
text: Have you heard, Horace? I am told the rebels just recaptured the palace. That accursed Akaneian wench! Never mind Camus’s pleas. We should have put her to the sword with the rest of them…

speaker: Dejanira
text: Hm, something bothering you, now? Don’t tell me you are toying with the idea of rejoining your motherland? Because if you do, I think you know exactly what will befall your people.

speaker: Horace
text: Yes, you’ve made it quite clear! I am an Akaneian knight no longer. I knew this day would come when I gave me lance to Doluna. I will not flinch.

speaker: Dejanira
text: Good. Then gather your soldiers and kill these rebels before they cause any more trouble.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Lord Horace, our soldiers are in position.

speaker: Horace
text: Good.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Shall we advance on the enemy?

speaker: Horace
text: ...No. That won’t be necessary. We’ll lure them in close, then strike. No one attacks unless the enemy makes a move first. Is that clear?

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Horace! I am Marth of Altea. I ask that you lay down your arms....

speaker: Horace
text: Is Princess Nyna safe?

speaker: Marth
text: She is- and she’s quite worried about you, sir.

speaker: Horace
text: So Her Highness is alive... The soldiers who died protecting her can rest in peace. ...Now then, Prince Marth. Draw your sword.

speaker: Marth
text: What? But...Lord Horace!

speaker: Horace
text: I chose to betray Akaneia, and now I must abide by that choice. Princess Nyna has returned to the palace, and Akaneia is restored. I have no regrets.

speaker: Old Man
text: Lord Horace, who rules this land, used to be a knight of Akaneia. After the palace fell, though, he bent his knee to the Dolunian emperor and has been servin’ him ever since. For that, folks call him a traitor and say he tarnished his knightly brethren’s reputation. Well, that’s a load of hogwash. He broke his knightly oaths to protect us! Not ’cause he’s some traitor. Please, sire, you have to help clear his name. Here…Lord Horace’s father, bless him, gave me this weapon as a gift long ago. I know he’d be glad to see it used to restore his son’s honor.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Are you with the League? Please, sir, I’m beggin’ ya...You have to help Lord Horace. He’s always looked out for us small folk, before and after he inherited the land. He’s a pillar of strength, he is. We’d be dead if he hadn’t made the tough choices he did. The least we can do is rescue him from his plight now. Here, I’ve got this magic tome one of our villagers found after the last battle on our soil. You take it, and find some way to save him. Promise!

speaker: Dejanira
text: Vexatious rebels! I’ll skewer you like rabbits!

speaker: Dejanira
text: Nngh! You'll... pay...

speaker: Horace
text: What!? Dejanira’s been killed?! Then... it’s over. Soldiers! Lay down your weapons! No more Akaneian blood shall be shed! ...Mine shall be the last.

speaker: Horace
text: Bravo, Prince Marth. I yield. Spare the lives of my soldiers and treat my people kindly, and you may do with me as you see fit.

speaker: Villager
text: No! Wait, please! Lord Horace is a good man! Doluna threatened him, said they’d raze the land corner to corner if he didn’t comply. So you see-

speaker: Horace
text: Hush! You’ve said enough.

speaker: Marth
text: But, Lord Horace...

speaker: Horace
text: I betrayed my fellow knights and besmirched their good name. I will not dress up my sins as kindnesses! I accept my punishment. Allow me to die a knight’s death.

speaker: Nyna
text: I will not!

speaker: Horace
text: .....! Princess Nyna?

speaker: Nyna
text: Horace. I heard what you said. And you have it quite right. Your crimes deserve death, or worse.

speaker: Marth
text: Nyna, what are you-

speaker: Nyna
text: But I shall give you no knight’s death. I shall give you a traitor’s life. You say you will not dress up your sins. I say you will not run from them either.

speaker: Horace
text: Your Highness...! Are you saying you wish me to live?

speaker: Nyna
text: You did all in your power to protect these people. That was honorable, Horace. But if you die today, no one will remember you for anything but your one act of betrayal. Your soldiers will have to bear that shame in your stead. Do you call that justice?

speaker: Nyna
text: Starting today, you shall prove to the world there was value in your actions. Show us a traitor’s worth. Show us what the soldiers who fought and died for you saw to be true.

speaker: Horace
text: I... I do not know what to say.

speaker: Nyna
text: I have claimed your life, Horace. You have no say. You shall fight for us...and you shall not die. I forbid it.

speaker: Horace
text: Heh... Very well, Your Highness. As you command...

speaker: Marth
text: Nyna, we have put down the western insurgence.

speaker: Nyna
text: And Horace?

speaker: Marth
text: I am sorry...

speaker: Nyna
text: Poor Horace. Marth, in his heart, I do not think he truly wished to betray Akaneia.

speaker: Marth
text: Nor I. Doluna must have threatened to do harm to his people.

speaker: Marth
text: So Horace capitulated, to keep them safe... He acted to save lives, yet the world will brand him a traitor. That one word will come to define him... and none will ever know the traitor’s worth.

speaker: Midia
text: Bishop, what do you make of this? I hear shouting in the corridors.

speaker: Boah
text: Hmm...Princess Nyna must have returned with an army in tow.

speaker: Midia
text: An army?! Really? Then we are saved!

speaker: Boah
text: Saved, perhaps...or doomed. Surely the enemy realizes we are more trouble alive than dead now.

speaker: Midia
text: You do not take my meaning, Bishop. By "we" I mean Archanea. Archanea is saved. If Princess Nyna has truly come to chase the enemy from our halls, to free us...Then my death will have meaning.

speaker: Boah
text: Ho ho...I admire your spirit, child. I always have. But think how Astram would grieve if you were to die.

speaker: Midia
text: I...I had hoped to see him one last time- to say goodbye. That alone I regret.

speaker: Boah
text: Ah, but you have not died yet. Midia. Hang on to hope.

speaker: Volzhin
text: Rebel pup! You dare defy Dolhr? Then writhe in the fires of Bolganone!

speaker: Volzhin
text: Do not think...you have won... Dolhr...is undying... Nngh!

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, thank you. Were it not for you, I may never have seen the halls of my house again.

speaker: Marth
text: I could not have done it alone, Nyna. The whole Archanean League fought tooth and nail this day.

speaker: Nyna
text: True, and yet all the same... I have little doubt your exploits are the ones that will live on in song. I have a gift for you, to celebrate your achievements here. This bow is called Parthia. It is one of the three regalia that have been passed down through House Archanea. The other two regalia- the sword Mercurius and the lance Gradivus are not here. The enemy took them when they fled. I am sorry. I had hoped to give you all three, and thus aid you in the battles to come....

speaker: Marth
text: Your concern for me is more than enough, Nyna. One day, I will get your family's treasures back and use them to crush Dolhr. I swear it on this emblem of fire!

speaker: Malledus
text: Prince Marth, I see them: a cohort of Grustian knights, out on the far side of the bridge. That must be the Sable Order...

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, I heard the enemy forces have been spotted.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, that’s right. The Sable Order, it seems

speaker: Nyna
text: Really? Tell me, who leads them?

speaker: Marth
text: Why does it matter?

speaker: Nyna
text: Oh... no, it’s just- they say the Sable Order is led by a brilliant general. I was... wondering if he was riding with them today.

speaker: Marth
text: You must mean General Camus. I am told Dolhr is not very happy with him at the moment, brilliant or not. Something about acting outside orders... They’ll be keeping him on a short leash; I don’t expect we’ll see him here.

speaker: Nyna
text: That... that is good news...

speaker: Young Man
text: You know how the Fane of Raman is supposed to be protected by a fearsome guardian? Well, I heard the “fearsome guardian” is nowt but a wee lass. If that’s true, you have to wonder why she’d stay all by herself in a dreary place like that. Mayhap she broke her ma’s favorite vase and got stuck there as a punishment? Ha ha, right.

speaker: Est
text: Ah, you’re Prince Marth! I am Est, of the Medonian Whitewings- Palla and Catria’s younger sister. I’ve been looking for you. Initially I intended to join up with you along with my sisters, but then I heard Grust had made off with one of Akaneia’s three regalia- the sword Mercurius- so I flew there to get it back. This is Mercurius right here. It’s lovely, isn’t it? And powerful! In the right hands, I think you’ll find it a formidable weapon indeed.

speaker: Est
text: Catria!

speaker: Catria
text: Est! It's about time you made it back. I was so worried...

speaker: Est
text: Sorry... I won't leave you like that again. We belong together anyway. When the three of us surround an enemy, we're just about unstoppable!

speaker: Catria
text: True... but even so, I like having you somewhere I can keep an eye on you. Ha ha.

speaker: Est
text: Hey! What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Est
text: Hey, Palla. I'm not slowing you and Catria down, am I?

speaker: Palla
text: Why would you say that?

speaker: Est
text: I don't know... You and she have so much more experience. Sometimes I... I just feel like I'm not pulling my load.

speaker: Palla
text: Ha ha... Est... You're doing just fine. There are no half-Whitewings or almost-Whitewings. You're one of us because you're every bit as good as us. Have a little confidence.

speaker: Est
text: Right, confidence...

speaker: Palla
text: ...Feel better?

speaker: Est
text: Uh-huh. Thanks, Palla. It's funny... Whenever I talk to you, I calm right down. Promise you'll always be there for me, Palla.

speaker: Palla
text: I will... I promise.

speaker: Est
text: Commander, did anybody tell you? I flew all the way to Grust and brought back Mercurius. Pretty spiffy, huh?

speaker: Minerva
text: Yes, Marth told me all about it. Very brave of you to undertake such a dangerous task alone. Well done, Est.

speaker: Est
text: Hee hee! You mean it? Thanks, Commander! You should have seen the arrows whooshing past me left and right! But I'm a Whitewing, right? So I swooped down and let 'em have it! Just watch, though. I'll find some way to top it.

speaker: Minerva
text: I don't doubt it. I expect great things from you, Est.

speaker: Est
text: Hee hee! You mean it?

speaker: Sternlin
text: You shall not pass! Not today! Not ever!

speaker: Sternlin
text: You... shall... not... unnh...

speaker: Nyna
text: We’ve made it across the strait.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes. But the real battle may yet be ahead of us.

speaker: Marth
text: Malledus... Can we be certain the Lightsphere and the Starsphere are in the Fane of Raman?

speaker: Malledus
text: Yes, sire; but unfortunately, they may not be all we find. The fane is said to be guarded by a goddess, one with fearsome powers. Those who defile her sanctuary are punished by fire; none are spared from the blaze.

speaker: Nyna
text: Perhaps we should reconsider, Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: Perhaps... But if none are spared from the blaze, where do the rumors come from? Besides, we need those two orbs.

speaker: Malledus
text: Well, might I suggest you take in just a few able companions, and let the sleeping dragons lie?

speaker: Marth
text: Sage advice. I’ve no desire to tear apart a holy place, whether the goddess is home or not... I’ll choose a handful of elite to search for the orbs with me.

speaker: Marth
text: The Temple of Thabes... He’s here... somewhere...
Heh heh heh... Come to play, little Marth?

speaker: Gharnef
text: ‘Tis I, Gharnef. I have been waiting for you.

speaker: Marth
text: Waiting?

speaker: Gharnef
text: Oh yes. For you to dance around the continent, collecting powerful weapons and killing off my competition. Thanks to you, Camus and Michalis will trouble me no more. You have my gratitude, diligent prince.

speaker: Marth
text: You... monster!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Tsk, tsk, don’t spoil the moment, now. You’re about to do me one last favor... Die, Prince. Heh heh heh!

speaker: Marth
text: That’s what you think. I have something else in mind.

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh, is that a threat? If you mean to harm me, first you’ll have to find me, boy.

speaker: Marth
text: And what is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Malledus
text: My prince! Several sorcerers have been sighted throughout the temple! They’re... They all seem to be Gharnef, sire!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh! Fight, boy, fight! Wear yourself thin fighting puppets and shadows! But the only way you’ll claim Falchion is by defeating the real me. Heh heh, ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, we’ve pinpointed where Gharnef is keeping the magical apparatus that gives him his power.

speaker: Marth
text: Where?

speaker: Malledus
text: The Tower of Thabes atop this very temple.

speaker: Marth
text: Then we don’t need to fight Gharnef... If we find those apparatus.

speaker: Malledus
text: Gharnef’s power- a great deal of power- will be sealed forever.

speaker: Marth
text: Then let’s hurry and seize the entrance to the tower!

speaker: Malledus
text: A word of caution, sir. Stopping the apparatus will not undo Imhullu power- only Gharnef’s. He still has Falchion in his keeping; if you want the blade back, you must defeat him now, before seizing the tower.

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh heh... You dare challenge me, fool? You must not value your life. Cower before the might of the dark magic Imhullu!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Agh! What... Where did you get...Starlight...? Still, you are a fool...Your power is not enough to defeat Medeus... I shall be waiting in the pits of the inferno... for when he sends you to join me... Heh heh, ha ha ha!

speaker: Marth
text: Malledus! Quickly! Find the apparatus and shut them down!

speaker: Malledus
text: Right away, sire!

speaker: Gharnef
text: ...Blast! How... how did they find the apparatus? All my power... Still, they are fools if they think they can defeat Medeus with such cheap tricks... Heh heh, ha ha ha!

speaker: Malledus
text: Gharnef is getting away, sire! Shall we give chase?

speaker: Marth
text: No... let him go. Without his magical apparatus, he has no power left to abuse.

speaker: Allied Solider
text: Sire! We found Princess Elice up in the Tower of Thabes! She’s on her way to see you right- Ah, here she is!

speaker: Marth
text: Elice!!!

speaker: Elice
text: Marth! Oh look at you. A man grown!

speaker: Marth
text: Sister, I was so worried. None had seen you since the castle fell. I... I feared the worst.

speaker: Elice
text: I was prepared for the worst, if that was what it took to ensure your safety. But they did not kill me. Gharnef spared my life.

speaker: Marth
text: Why would he spare you?

speaker: Elice
text: Marth, have you heard of the staff of Aum?

speaker: Marth
text: The staff that brings back the dead? It was lost to the world long ago, or so the legend goes.

speaker: Elice
text: Yes, but Gharnef found it... in the Resurrectory.

speaker: Marth
text: The Resurrectory? What was it doing in a temple in the middle of Dolhr?

speaker: Elice
text: I could not say. But that was why Gharnef kept me alive: he wished me to wield it. The staff of Aum’s power can only be channeled by women of royal blood. Marth, you are going to Dolhr, are you not?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes. I must settle things with Medeus.

speaker: Elice
text: Then take me to the Resurrectory along the way to claim the staff. Aum works but once, but I will use it to revive a lost comrade.

speaker: Marth
text: Princess Minerva, we will soon reach the Macedonian border. Are you certain you wish to join the battle? If you’ve any reservations about fighting your own countrymen-

speaker: Minerva
text: If I did, Prince Marth, I would not have offered you my axe.

speaker: Marth
text: But surely-

speaker: Minerva
text: You have the wrong idea. Perhaps you think I wish to spare my brother and former vassals, forgive them for seeing things differently?

speaker: Marth
text: ...Don’t you?

speaker: Minerva
text: I would be lying if I said I did not wish it were that simple. But history needs to remember that when Macedon went astray, it was a Macedonian who set things right.

speaker: Marth
text: Even if it means your own brother may die?

speaker: Minerva
text: Since I was little, I followed in Michalis’s footsteps. Whatever books he read, I read; whenever he practiced the sword, I was close by, watching, learning... He was always a step ahead: my hero, something to aspire to. Even now, some part of me loves him. ...I love him enough to spare him death on some stranger’s sword, you see? Let him be punished by my hands.

speaker: Orridyon
text: Rebels! You have strutted into the wrong kingdom this time!

speaker: Orridyon
text: Nngh! I am but a pebble... in Macedon's unshakeable foundation...

speaker: Gotoh
text: ...Prince Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: That voice! Lord Gotoh, is that you?

speaker: Gotoh
text: I see you have made it to Macedon. You will find me in a village north of the Macedon aerie, their castle. If you possess the Lightsphere and Starsphere, have them in hand when you visit me here. ...Ah, yes. I also have good news. Your sister Elice is unharmed.

speaker: Marth
text: What?! You are certain? Where is she now?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Thabes, city of illusion. Gharnef took her with him when he fled. I pray you rescue her soon.

speaker: Marth
text: I will!

speaker: Gotoh
text: But first, bring me the two orbs. Without Starlight’s mighty blast, Gharnef will only add your life to the list of things he has taken from you.

speaker: Malledus
text: Prince Marth. ...Sire? Sire! Are you listening?!

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? ...Oh. Malledus.

speaker: Malledus
text: Get ahold of yourself, Sire! I know how you grieve, but the Gra host that pursues us will not be interested. We must keep moving, and with all haste at that.

speaker: Marth
text: I...I'm sorry. These thoughts are hard to put aside.

speaker: Malledus
text: From here, we will cross out of Altea and begin our escape to Talys. I trust you are prepared?

speaker: Marth
text: Talys... I've heard the name. An island kingdom to the east, isn't it?

speaker: Malledus
text: That is correct. The king there was a good friend to your father- and perhaps more importantly, a true friend. It was Princess Elice's wish that you seek refuge in Talys should things ever go awry.

speaker: Marth
text: Me, but not her...

speaker: Malledus
text: I've arranged for a boat to take us from the northeast shore. But to get there, we'll first need to cut through a prison to the north. I managed to come by a key to the premises. Let me hand it over.

speaker: Malledus
text: Now, on the road, you may notice people who seem to be fighting for Gra against their own wishes. Before you resort to your blade, you should try talking to them first.

speaker: Young Man
text: Boy, I don’t envy you! The enemy horde is closing in on you faster’n a bolt of Thoron. You and your friends had better hightail it on outta here!

speaker: Old Man
text: Sometimes victory on a battlefield requires that someone you care about make a sacrifice. But parting with one comrade may be the only way to meet another. You need to accept your losses in life and move forward.

speaker: Woman
text: My word! Aren’t you–No, you cannot stay here! Run! Before their soldiers come back! Here, this is the bow my granddaughter always used. Take it, sire! Please, promise you’ll stay safe...

speaker: Captain
text: Enemies south of the prison?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir. Not many of 'em, but the scouts say they're a tough bunch all the same. And guess who's with 'em...

speaker: Captain
text: ...You're saying the prince is coming this way?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir. How ought we proceed? The main force ‘as yet to arrive, and- to be honest, sir- we need 'em.

speaker: Captain
text: Bah! You're cowed too easily. We can win...if we set a trap.

speaker: Soldier
text: Er...a trap, sir?

speaker: Captain
text: The prince of Altea will be ours. Just do as I tell you, and we'll pluck this royal plum long before the main force can show up to steal all the glory. Heh...

speaker: Ruffian
text: You! Inside!

speaker: Gordin
text: Grrrmph...

speaker: Ruffian
text: Heh. I thought Altea was the great ‘ero Anri's kingdom! Didn't take more'n a couple of days to break you, now did it, Gaggles?

speaker: Gordin
text: Mmph! Arrumph!

speaker: Ruffian
text: What's the matter, Gaggles? Can't talk cause you're gagged, Gaggles? Ba ha ha! I'll letcha in on a little secret. Altea's little princeling is on ‘is way ‘ere right this moment.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Ooh, but sad for you, you look awful dangerous in the uniform... MISTER GRA SOLDIER! Ha! Soon as the prince sees you, ‘e'll say, Yow! It's an enemy ambush!-And that'll be the end of you.

speaker: Gordin
text: Gugrrrmph!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Once the prince sticks you like a pig, we get to call him Marth the Tyrant, coz ‘e kills ‘is own countrymen.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Won't that be an ‘oot!

speaker: Gordin
text: Rrrmph.

speaker: Ruffian
text: So long, Gaggles! Better start praying to your ‘igher deity of choice!

speaker: Jiol
text: Listen, men. Your target is the prince. Find the prince of Altea and bring me his head served on a shield!

speaker: Marth
text: Look there!

speaker: Malledus
text: No...Anri save us...Of all the places to be beset! Sire, that is Gra's main force- and they are accompanied by the knights of Grust's Sable Order. Our chances of routing them are slim, I'm afraid, and those of slipping away undetected afterward, all but nil...

speaker: Marth
text: Then we've no hope?

speaker: Malledus
text: I...I can think of one strategy. We could leave a decoy behind for when the enemy catches up.

speaker: Marth
text: A decoy?

speaker: Malledus
text: It's you they're after, sire. Were one of your men to stay behind disguised as you...Well, the enemy ought to take the bait. That would give you, and the others time to escape.

speaker: Malledus
text: One of your men must make for that fortress on the south highroad. He will act as a decoy by dressing as you and luring the enemy force away.

speaker: Marth
text: But Malledus, how will he find his way back to us?

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire...He may not. You must part with one of your comrades. There is no other way.

speaker: Marth
text: ...Well, I will find a way! You cannot expect me to agree to...to abandon one of our own to a death at the hands of the enemy. Surely there must be another way...

speaker: Malledus
text: Forgive me, sire...But this is our only chance. You know as well as I do that you must not die here today.

speaker: Malledus
text: No, sire! Get back here! One of your other men must take that position!

speaker: Enemy Soldier 1
text: Look! It's...it's Prince Marth!

speaker: Enemy Soldier 2
text: Oh yeah? Who's that, then? That bloke over there is dressed in the same clothes. Could be either of 'em.

speaker: Jiol
text: Simpletons! Use your heads! One of them ran; the other didn't. What does that tell you? Easy! The one who stayed behind is trying to buy time for the one who fled.

speaker: Enemy Solider
text: So, er...the one who took off is-

speaker: Jiol
text: The real prince, you idiot, yes! Hie, troops, after him! Put that craven whip to the sword!

speaker: Marth
text: Wait! Quickly, Malledus, we must head south and rescue him!

speaker: Malledus
text: No, sire. We have to press on.

speaker: Marth
text: Press on? (Insert name) might be dying back there!

speaker: Malledus
text: If he were, then why would you be so selfish as to let him die in vain? Honor him, by allowing his life and his choice to mean something!

speaker: Marth
text: ...All right.

speaker: Marth
text: I will honor him. ...I will go.

speaker: Captain
text: The prince fled south? Bah! Seems the plum's fallen too far from our tree... No matter. Open the north door! We can still crush the Altean rabble he left behind...

speaker: Marth
text: Blast! That archer was on our side!

speaker: Captain
text: They killed the captive? Heh heh... What fools! Hie, let's give them the punishment fools deserve! Open the north door! Lure them out and strike them down!

speaker: Captain
text: All but the prince have been slain? Good. Open the north door! The little whelp is ours now!

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, there is a village over yonder. Its residents may be willing to help. Why don't you try paying them a visit?

speaker: Draug
text: Prince Marth! Make haste, sire!

speaker: Marth
text: Draug, is that you? What are you doing here?

speaker: Norne
text: Draug, sir! The enemy has crossed the border from the west! They’ll be upon us soon!

speaker: Draug
text: Right, we’re on our way. Sire, this is Norne. She heard wind of our struggles and wishes to fight for Altea.

speaker: Norne
text: Prince Marth, ’tis an honor. By your leave, though, I’ll be savin' the curtsy-bobbin' for later. Quickly, sire!

speaker: Jiol
text: This is...the wrong prince? No! You dare make a fool of me? Kill him! Make this faux prince SUFFER!

speaker: Gordin
text: May I suffer for my sins...

speaker: Marth
text: Yow! It's an enemy ambush!

speaker: Gordin
text: Rrrgmph mrph!

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? You've been gagged? Here, I'll get that... Wait, I know you! You're one of our archers, er...

speaker: Gordin
text: Gordin, sire! My name is Gordin. The enemy captured me and left me in this mortifying state.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. Well, I'm glad you're unharmed. But I'm afraid we cannot stay here a moment longer. Stay behind me and-

speaker: Gordin
text: I can fight, sire! If you have a bow I could use, I would be honored to fight at your side.

speaker: Jagen
text: Heh, these old bones are still good for something. Farewell, my prince. Live, and grow strong...

speaker: Cain
text: Glory to Altea, land of my birth! Farewell, sire! Fortune protect you...

speaker: Abel
text: Good... Altea's hope is restored. Farewell sire. Fortune protect you...

speaker: Frey
text: Count this knight honored to die in the service of his prince. Live, sire, and grow strong...

speaker: Gordin
text: I was dead anyway till you came, sir... If I'm to die again, at least let me die for you. Fortune protect you sire...

speaker: Jagen
text: Look, sire. See how Altea shrinks on the horizon...

speaker: Marth
text: ..aven...

speaker: Jagen
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Marth
text: I am a craven. Powerless to save my sister, to staunch my kingdom's wounds; to ease my people's fears...

speaker: Jagen
text: This...was your only recourse, sire. But surely, one day, you will be able to set things right...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire...

speaker: Marth
text: I will return, Altea! Your prince will return to you one day!

speaker: Soldier
text: Prince Marth... Are you awake? Beggin' your pardon, sire, but the princess has asked to see you.

speaker: Marth
text: Elice? Is she all right?"

speaker: Soldier
text: She seemed to be, sire, but her words implied a certain urgency. She bade you dress quickly and wait by the throne.

speaker: Marth
text: ...Has something happened?

speaker: Soldier
text: It's our forces off in Gra, sire. There seems to 'ave been some sort of incident, but... Well, I'm not privy to the specifics.

speaker: Marth
text: I see... Thank you. I'll be there shortly.

speaker: Marth
text: My sister said she would meet me by the throne.

speaker: Marth
text: An incident in Gra... If Elice had news of our father, I pray it's good news...

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: O'er there, that's him! Prince Marth!

speaker: Marth
text: Wha- Who are you?!

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: We're soldiers of Gra, li'l prince. And if you know what's good for you, you'll surrender to us without makin' any trouble.

speaker: Marth
text: Surrender? But that's ridiculous... Why would I surrender to the army of an allied kingdom?

speaker: Marth
text: I will not. I am the prince of Altea. I will not yield to you or any other nation, here on my own land, under my own castle roof!

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Heh, you talk big, brat. Have it your way. If you won't lay down your sword, then we'll just have to take your life instead!

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: What? He is fighting back? I'll show him!

speaker: Marth
text: No! The throne... I have to get rid of him before my sister arrives!

speaker: Elice
text: Marth, are you all right?

speaker: Marth
text: Sister, what is happening?

speaker: Elice
text: Steady yourself, Marth. I have grave news. Our father was defeated by the Dolhr-Grust allied forces.

speaker: Marth
text: What? No...

speaker: Elice
text: It was Gra. Our own ally betrayed us and struck Father's army from the rear. I am... I am not sure if he is safe. The scouts who returned gave conflicting reports...

speaker: Marth
text: Father...It can't be...

speaker: Elice
text: As we speak, soldiers sent by Gra are trying to take the castle. Mother and I were separated during the escape. I do not know where she is.

speaker: Elice
text: Marth, I need you to listen to me. You must flee the castle. Go on without me.

speaker: Marth
text: What?

speaker: Elice
text: We've not many soldiers left...This is hard to bear, I know, but the castle is lost. We must face that. I will look for Mother and join you as soon as I can. You find Jagen and get away from here- far away. Understand?

speaker: Marth
text: ...All right. But promise you won't be long.

speaker: Maria
text: Oh! You must be Prince Marth! (My, he's so dashing!) ...Thank you for rescuing me. Please be sure to tell my sister I am free. She'll be grateful for the news. Now then. Shall we be off? I'm coming with you, of course.; ...No protesting! I wish to help!

speaker: Minerva
text: Greetings, Prince Marth. I am Minerva of Macedon. Thank you for saving my sister. Maria's plight forced me to treat you as an enemy when I knew you were not; suffice to say, I am deeply sorry for that. ...The whole world has gone mad. Most of Macedon fights for Dolhr now. My own brother Michalis leads them. And on their hands is the blood of their king, my father. They must be stopped; I must stop them. Still, I fear for my soldiers whom I can no longer protect, especially the three Whitewing sisters: Palla, Catria, and Est. Dolhr worried we would rebel, and forced us to separate. If they knew I was safe, they would join your ranks in a heartbeat. We are yours to command, sire. Let us help you defeat Dolhr, and repay them for sullying Macedon's honor.

speaker: Maria
text: Sister!

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria... Are you all right?

speaker: Maria
text: Fine. Have you heard? Marth made me one of his soldiers! Well...I made him make me one.

speaker: Minerva
