text: ...What am I going to do with you? Listen to me, Maria... you cannot stay here. It's too dangerous. Real war is nothing like your stories of princes and damsels.

speaker: Maria
text: I'm not going anywhere! I want to stay with you!

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria, you're being selfish–

speaker: Maria
text: I am not! I'm just...sick of being helpless. I've burdened you long enough. How can I ever help you if you don't give me a chance to be strong? I'm staying here and fighting! No protesting!

speaker: Minerva
text: ...Ha ha. Somehow I knew you would say that. All right, Maria. If you feel that strongly about it, who am I to stop you? All I ask is that you be careful. If you need help, you come find me. Understood?

speaker: Maria
text: Of course! Thank you, Sister!

speaker: Zharov
text: Grrr... Must I do everything myself? Bah! You'll not get past me, rebel!

speaker: Zharov
text: They're a force... to be reckoned... with... Rrgh...

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, have you ever heard of Pontifex Miloah?

speaker: Marth
text: The one who defended Archanea with the power of Aura? Of course; he and his magic are famous! But...I read Miloah died in a battle with Gharnef, soon after the fiend sold his soul to Dolhr...

speaker: Nyna
text: Alas, Miloah did die... But his daughter, Linde, yet lives. I am told she inherited her father's skill with Aura magic- but since the battle with Gharnef none have seen her. Wherever she is, it cannot be pleasant. ...Marth, please. Find Linde. With her father gone, we are the only family the girl has left.

speaker: Emereus
text: What?! The rebels are inside the castle? Grrr…Very well! Armored units: intercept the intruders! Archers: defend the throne! Thieves, you go gather up the treasure while I make preparations to withdraw. You have your orders! Don’t let those rebels anywhere near this chamber!

speaker: Julian
text: What the- Rickard? What are you doin’ in here?

speaker: Rickard
text: Oh, uh… Hey there, Chief! Been a long time, huh? So, funny story: I decided to break in here and clean the place out- and then I got caught. Hilarious, right? Comedy gold. OK, your turn What are YOU doin’ here?

speaker: Julian
text: Me? I’ve washed my hands of thievery and joined the forces of justice.

speaker: Rickard
text: Ohhh really? Justice? So then this wouldn’t have nothin’ to do with some new lady friend? You always did have a soft spot for a pretty face and the right features-

speaker: Julian
text: Wha- Can it, you little fink! I said it’s about justice! I’m entitled to have moral crisis now and then! …You know what? Just for that, YOU are gonna work for me, startin’ right now.

speaker: Rickard
text: What? Do I have to…? Well, all right. You drive a hard bargain, but what can I say? I missed ya, Chief. Just make sure I get a cut out of the haul!

speaker: Rickard
text: …Wow! Really? A prince, you say? Thanks for springin’ me! I’m Rickard, just a small-time thief, mind you, but I’ve got big aspirations! I broke in here to clean the place out, and instead it was me that got my cloak cleaned… Since you saved my hide, I guess the least I can do is lend my services in return.

speaker: Rickard
text: So you’re the prince of Altea, then? Hello. I’m Rickard. Just a small-time thief, mind you, but I’ve got big aspirations! Julian asked me to help you out, see, and what the chief says, goes! So here I am.

speaker: Emereus
text: Blast! They're upon me! Why didn't those idiot soldiers stop them?!

speaker: Emereus
text: Rrgh... Why... ?

speaker: Nyna
text: Prince Marth… At long last. I am Nyna of House Archanea. ‘Tis Archanea’s burden to protect the world of crisis- a duty I have striven to fulfill. But Dolhr has laid waste to my kingdom, and now I find myself powerless to stop the world from falling into ruin. Marth… Please, pick up the banner where I have let it fall. Lead your might against Dolhr, and free us all.

speaker: Marth
text: Of course, Princess Nyna. Altea swore fealty to Archanea long ago, a vow we have always kept. And, as you know, it is in my blood – House Altea’s blood – to destroy Medeus just as Anri did before me.

speaker: Nyna
text: Thank you, Marth. Then let me give you this. This crest is called the Fire Emblem. House Archanea bestows it only upon a true champion, one we believe has the power to save the world. With it, you gain the right to open treasure chests across the land and wield the precious items within. I know you will use them well. Never give up, Marth. Fight, until the day you restore light to our world.

speaker: Morzas
text: Kee hee hee... Wretched Altean whelp, stumbling home to the slaughter... What fool throws away a life already so preciously bought? Your mother, Liza, is dead; I killed her myself. Your sister Elice lives only because Gharnef wanted her. So what will become of you, little prince? Will you run for your life a second time? Or will you stay this time to die? Emperor Medeus would not put me on this throne if he thought you could remove me from it, kee hee hee...

speaker: Morzas
text: Kee hee... Witless human! None defy a mage-dragon and live to speak of it!

speaker: Morzas
text: Grrf... I stand... corrected...B ut you still lack the power... to defeat Medeus...

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth! Any word? Have you found your family? Your sister?

speaker: Marth
text: ...My sister was taken by Gharnef. She is no longer here... And my...my mother is... She is dead. Slain...by that Dolhrian dragon...

speaker: Nyna
text: ....! Marth, I am truly sorry...

speaker: Marth
text: I thought there would be something...some part of my old life I would be coming back to. I fought so hard...

speaker: Nyna
text: You fought wonderfully, Marth.

speaker: Malledus
text: ...Sire, might I have a moment?

speaker: Marth
text: All the moments you want, Malledus. What is it?

speaker: Malledus
text: Your people have gathered outside the castle. They are overjoyed to be free again, sire, and would like very much to see their prince.

speaker: Marth
text: All right, then. I'll go at once.

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth...perhaps you should let that wait, just until you are able to share their joy with them. We could send someone in your stead-

speaker: Marth
text: No, that would not do. Today is a momentous day for my kingdom and my people. I must celebrate with them now, not later. Anything else would be a disservice to those who died to save Altea. I am a prince before I am a son or a brother. Come, Malledus. Let us go greet my people.

speaker: Marth
text: This must be the tower Lord Gotoh spoke of...

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, it’s teeming with soldiers... Who are they? They fly no recognizable banner.

speaker: Marth
text: They are the Keepers whose test I must pass.

speaker: Malledus
text: You mean to fight them, then?

speaker: Marth
text: Gotoh says we must prove ourselves. Very well; we’ll seize the tower. Follow me!

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire, look! Stairs beneath the throne! Where could they lead?

speaker: Malledus
text: ...Do you think this is the coffin?

speaker: Marth
text: There are no others. And look: these markings around it are the same pattern we saw in the Fane of Raman...

speaker: Malledus
text: Hmm, you’re right...

speaker: Marth
text: We found a dragon girl in the fane... I wonder if these symbols-Huh?!

speaker: Malledus
text: Sire! The coffin... It’s opening!

speaker: Marth
text: What? No! It must be some kind of trap, or... or some kind of... er...

speaker: Marth
text: ...woman? Could she be the master Gotoh spoke of?

speaker: Nagi
text: ...Who are you?

speaker: Marth
text: My name is Marth, prince of Altea. And you, my lady?

speaker: Nagi
text: Me?! My name... is Nagi.

speaker: Marth
text: Nagi... I was sent here to find you, by a man named Gotoh.

speaker: Nagi
text: Gotoh... I know that name...But from where? I cannot recall.

speaker: Marth
text: You’ve lost your memory?

speaker: Nagi
text: I... cannot say for certain. But your voice... I heard you calling. Did you rouse me from my sleep?

speaker: Marth
text: I... er... Not on purpose?

speaker: Nagi
text: Your soul... called out to me...begging for my help. For this blade...

speaker: Marth
text: That...that’s Falchion! How did you get it?!

speaker: Nagi
text: I cannot remember... But you need it, I know that. And you need my powers.

speaker: Marth
text: Your... powers, my lady?

speaker: Nagi
text: Take me with you. I must... finish what I started... I think. I must fight with you.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Lord Dactyl, I’ve brought the mage.

speaker: Dactyl
text: Good. Hold him up.

speaker: Dactyl
text: Well, then? Have you been persuaded to fight for us?

speaker: Etzel
text: ...Never. I’d rather die.

speaker: Dactyl
text: You’d rather DIE? Ha! As if a spell-slinging vagabond like you has any choice in the matter! Enough. Strip him of all his possessions and lock him up someplace. Perhaps we can use him later.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: There’s not much to strip him of, milord. Just the tome and this ring...

speaker: Dactyl
text: Ring? Let me have a look at that.

speaker: Etzel
text: No! Don’t you- Grr, let me go! Don’t you touch Ursula’s ring!

speaker: Dactyl
text: Wha... what are you- yaagh!

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: O-oi! Take your hands off Lord Dactyl!

speaker: Etzel
text: Rrgh... please, not the ring! ...Give it BACK!

speaker: Dactyl
text: Unhand me, you filthy maggot!

speaker: Etzel
text: Nngh! ...Unnh...

speaker: Dactyl
text: Take this wretch away. Now!

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: At once, milord!

speaker: Dactyl
text: Hmph, all that for some tawdry ring. ...Hmm? That gives me an idea...

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: I’ve brought him, milord.

speaker: Dactyl
text: Good. I’ve had a change of heart. I am considering giving that ring of yours back.

speaker: Dactyl
text: BUT...you must face the League for us. How much considering I do hinges on how well you fight.

speaker: Etzel
text: ...And how am I to fight unarmed, my lord?

speaker: Dactyl
text: Hmm? ...Ah. yes, well, you can have your little book back. But you know what the consequences will be if you betray us...

speaker: Etzel
text: For now, I’ll just have to feign obedience...

speaker: Etzel
text: Sorry. I mean you no harm, but neither have I any wish to die here.

speaker: Dactyl
text: Blast! Where have those indolent guards gone?

speaker: Dactyl
text: Unnh... gwaaah!

speaker: Malledus
text: Prince Marth! Grust’s garrison left their war chest when they fled. This much gold should buy plenty of equipment. Might I suggest, sire, you avail yourself of this opportunity to outfit your soldiers? Our next opponent will be Grust’s Sable Order. By our scouts’ reports, they march to meet us as we speak. Many say their knights are the strongest on the continent. We’ll want to be well prepared.

speaker: Etzel
text: You’re Prince Marth, aren’t you? I wish to thank you.

speaker: Marth
text: ...Who are you?

speaker: Etzel
text: My name is Etzel. I am a traveling sorcerer. Those Grustian cowards stole a ring from me, and were it not for you, I might never have seen it again.

speaker: Marth
text: The ring must have been very dear to you, then.

speaker: Etzel
text: It’s all I have to remember my wife by. She got caught in the fighting back when Gra betrayed Altea...

speaker: Marth
text: Those were dark days. You have my deepest sympathies; I lost my father in the same battle.

speaker: Etzel
text: Will there be no end to this bloodshed?

speaker: Marth
text: There will, Etzel. I have sworn to end it; that’s the very reason all of us fight.

speaker: Etzel
text: And you think you can end it, just like that? From anyone else’s lips that would sound absurdly naive. But I can tell you are sincere. Tell me, Prince, have you any need for an extra... spell slinger? I’ve no taste for war, but I do have a fierce hunger for ending it. Let’s usher in a new era, you and I.

speaker: Gharnef
text: Tiki... Tiki... Princess-that-was of the great divine dragons ...Can you hear my voice?

speaker: Tiki
text: ....Mm-hmm.

speaker: Gharnef
text: Defilers have set foot inside the fane- despoilers! Punish them. Let your fire consume them!

speaker: Tiki
text: Defilers... in the fane... Punish them...

speaker: Gharnef
text: Remember, Tiki. Your divine dragon kin perished long ago, and Bantu has abandoned you... I alone am protecting you from Medeus. Remember...

speaker: Tiki
text: You alone... are protecting me... Punish... the defilers...

speaker: Bantu
text: Tiki! Tiki, my child! At last, I have found you!

speaker: Tiki
text: No... Stop... Come no closer...

speaker: Bantu
text: Hm? ...Gharnef has put you in some sort of trance, poor thing. Peace, child. Peace. Awaken.

speaker: Tiki
text: ...Mmm? ....Ban-Ban? Is that you? Where am I? What happened?

speaker: Bantu
text: Yes, child. ’tis I, ’tis I. How I worried! Are you hurt?

speaker: Tiki
text: No, Ban-Ban, just...just scared...I feel as though I just woke from an awful nightmare...

speaker: Bantu
text: I am truly sorry, child. Truly, I am. I will not let us be separated again. From now on, I will be there to protect you.

speaker: Tiki
text: Promise? You have to promise, Ban-Ban. I hate being alone...

speaker: Tiki
text: N-no! Please! Come no closer!

speaker: Tiki
text: Ban-Ban... Wh-why did you leave me?

speaker: Marth
text: You must be Tiki. Bantu told me all about you.

speaker: Tiki
text: Ban-Ban told me all about you, too. Will you take me with you?

speaker: Marth
text: Of course, Tiki, as long as that’s what you want.

speaker: Tiki
text: Yes, yes, it is! Oh, thank you, Mar-Mar!

speaker: Marth
text: Mar-Mar?!

speaker: Tiki
text: Am I not allowed to call you that?

speaker: Marth
text: N- That is- Er- Well, if you want.

speaker: Tiki
text: Thank you, Mar-Mar!

speaker: Marth
text: You’re welcome?

speaker: Tiki
text: Huh? Xaney, where'd you go?

speaker: Xane
text: Huh? Xaney, where'd you go?

speaker: Tiki
text: Xaney?! Why are you imitating me!

speaker: Xane
text: Xaney?! Why are you imitating me!

speaker: Tiki
text: Cut that out right now!

speaker: Xane
text: Cut that out right now!

speaker: Tiki
text: Ugh, I HATE you, Xaney!

speaker: Xane
text: Huh? Hey, wait, Tiki! Oh come on. I was just jokin' around! Tryin' to lighten the mood! It's not like I can transform into a dragon like you so just– Oh, would you come back?

speaker: Tiki
text: Meanie.

speaker: Xane
text: So how are you holdin' up, kiddo?

speaker: Tiki
text: Im all right.

speaker: Xane
text: Still having those bad dreams?

speaker: Tiki
text: Sometimes. They're really scary...

speaker: Xane
text: I bet they are. (...Ugh, what does Lord Gotoh expect me to do?)

speaker: Tiki
text: Did you say something?

speaker: Xane
text: Oh! No, no, it's nothin'. Hey, you know that Marth's countin' on those powers of yours.

speaker: Tiki
text: Uh-huh... Why?

speaker: Xane
text: So, uh... you just take care of yourself, that's all. You're one special kid.

speaker: Tiki
text: I know.

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth! Tell me, was it a success? Did you locate the Lightsphere and Starsphere?

speaker: Marth
text: Never fear; I have them. We need to take these to Gotoh so he can undo Imhullu’s magic... But first, Nyna, we’ve a more pressing task ahead of us.

speaker: Nyna
text: Oh? And what is that?

speaker: Marth
text: We must defeat Grust once and for all. If we march south without finishing them off, we have our rear exposed.

speaker: Nyna
text: Then you mean to invade.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes. And this time, General Camus will be there to meet us. I am sure of it. Camus the Sable, they call him. Many extol him as the most able warrior alive. It will be a fierce battle... but one we cannot avoid.

speaker: Nyna
text: You are certain we must face him?

speaker: Marth
text: We have crippled Grust, but they will regroup and stand in our way again. No, we need to stamp this fire out before the wind catches it and starts spreading it anew.

speaker: Nyna
text: Very well. But before you attack, there is something I must tell you. Later, though... Not yet. I must sort my feelings out first...
